edu.umd.cs.jazz.util
Class ZFrame

java.lang.Object
  |

        |

              |
              +--java.awt.Window

                    +--java.awt.Frame

                                |
                                +--edu.umd.cs.jazz.util.ZFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class ZFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

ZFrame is meant to be subclassed by Jazz applications that just need a ZCanvas in a JFrame. It also includes full screen mode functionality when run in JDK 1.4. To get this functionality you will need to uncomment code in the methods enterFullScreenMode() and exitFullScreenMode().

See Also:

Field Detail

fCanvas

protected ZCanvas fCanvas
The ZCanvas, Jazz's connection to swing.
Constructor Detail

ZFrame

public ZFrame()
Construct a new ZFrame. Application specific code should be put in ZFrame.initialize().
Method Detail

addListenersToWindow

public void addListenersToWindow()
Add two listeners to the Window. One to exit the application when the window is closed, and one to exit full screen mode when the escape key is pressed.

initialize

public void initialize()
Initialize your application from within the event dispatch thread.

enterFullScreenMode

public void enterFullScreenMode()
Enter full screen mode, this requires JDK 1.4 to compile and run. To stay compatible with JDK 1.3 this code is commented out by default, but if JDK 1.4 is being used the code can be uncommented.

exitFullScreenMode

public void exitFullScreenMode()
Exit full screen mode, this requires JDK 1.4 to compile and run. To stay compatible with JDK 1.3 this code is commented out by default, but if JDK 1.4 is being used the code can be uncommented.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
